summary.span: 在设定的间隔之后生成事件，带有生成重复事件的选项。

span.span: Generates an event after a set interval, with an option to generate recurring events.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 组件是一个基于服务器的计时器, 在属性中的毫秒数后, 在应用程序中引发事件。 The component is a server-based timer that raises an event in your application after the number of milliseconds in the property has elapsed. 您可以将对象配置为只引发一次事件, 或使用属性重复一次。You can configure the object to raise the event just once or repeatedly using the property. 通常, 在类级别声明对象, 使其在需要时保持在范围内。Typically, a object is declared at the class level so that it stays in scope as long as it is needed. 然后, 可以处理其事件以提供常规处理。You can then handle its event to provide regular processing. 例如, 假设你有一个关键服务器, 该服务器必须每周7天、每天24小时保持运行。For example, suppose you have a critical server that must be kept running 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. 你可以创建一个服务, 该服务使用对象来定期检查服务器, 并确保系统正常运行。You could create a service that uses a object to periodically check the server and ensure that the system is up and running. 如果系统未响应, 则服务可能会尝试重新启动服务器或通知管理员。If the system is not responding, the service could attempt to restart the server or notify an administrator. > [!IMPORTANT] > 该类并非适用于所有 .net 实现和版本, 如 .NET Standard 1.6 和更低版本。The class is not available for all .NET implementations and versions, such as .NET Standard 1.6 and lower versions. > 在这些情况下, 可以改用类。In these cases, you can use the class instead. 此类型实现 接口。This type implements the interface. 在使用完类型后，您应直接或间接释放类型。When you have finished using the type, you should dispose of it either directly or indirectly. 若要直接释放类型，请在 `try`/`catch` 块中调用其 方法。To dispose of the type directly, call its method in a `try`/`catch` block. 若要间接释放类型，请使用 `using`（在 C# 中）或 `Using`（在 Visual Basic 中）等语言构造。To dispose of it indirectly, use a language construct such as `using` (in C#) or `Using` (in Visual Basic). 有关详细信息，请参阅 接口主题中的“使用实现 IDisposable 的对象”一节。For more information, see the "Using an Object that Implements IDisposable" section in the interface topic. 基于服务器的类用于多线程环境中的工作线程。The server-based class is designed for use with worker threads in a multithreaded environment. 服务器计时器可以在线程之间移动以处理引发的事件, 从而比引发事件时的 Windows 计时器更为精确。Server timers can move among threads to handle the raised event, resulting in more accuracy than Windows timers in raising the event on time. 组件根据属性的值 (以毫秒为单位) 引发事件。 The component raises the event, based on the value (in milliseconds) of the property. 可以处理此事件以执行所需的处理。You can handle this event to perform the processing you need. 例如, 假设您有一个联机销售应用程序, 该应用程序持续将销售订单发送到数据库。For example, suppose that you have an online sales application that continuously posts sales orders to a database. 用于对装运的说明进行编译的服务在一批订单上操作, 而不是单独处理每个订单。The service that compiles the instructions for shipping operates on a batch of orders rather than processing each order individually. 您可以使用来每30分钟启动一次批处理。You could use a to start the batch processing every 30 minutes. > [!IMPORTANT] > 系统定时器类的分辨率与系统时钟相同。The System.Timers.Timer class has the same resolution as the system clock. 这意味着, 如果属性小于系统时钟的分辨率, 则将以系统时钟解析定义的间隔触发事件。This means that the event will fire at an interval defined by the resolution of the system clock if the property is less than the resolution of the system clock. 有关更多信息，请参见 属性。For more information, see the property. 当设置为`false`时 ,对象在第一次运行后仅引发一次事件。When is set to `false`, a object raises the event only once, after the first has elapsed. 若要按定义 的间隔持续引发事件, 请将设置为`true`, 这是默认值。To keep raising the event regularly at the interval defined by the , set to `true`, which is the default value. 组件捕获并取消事件的事件处理程序引发的所有异常。 The component catches and suppresses all exceptions thrown by event handlers for the event. 在未来版本的 .NET Framework 中, 此行为可能会发生更改。This behavior is subject to change in future releases of the .NET Framework. 但请注意, 这对于异步执行的事件处理程序并不是如此, 包括`await`运算符 (在C#中) 或`Await`运算符 (在 Visual Basic 中)。Note, however, that this is not true of event handlers that execute asynchronously and include the `await` operator (in C#) or the `Await` operator (in Visual Basic). 这些事件处理程序中引发的异常将传播回调用线程, 如下面的示例所示。Exceptions thrown in these event handlers are propagated back to the calling thread, as the following example illustrates. 有关异步方法中引发的异常的详细信息, 请参阅[异常处理](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md)。For more information on exceptions thrown in asynchronous methods, see [Exception Handling](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md). [!code-csharp[System.Timers.Timer#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timers.timer/cs/AsyncHandlerEx1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Timers.Timer#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timers.timer/vb/AsyncHandlerEx1.vb#3)] 如果属性为`null` ,则在线程上引发事件。 If the property is `null`, the event is raised on a thread. 如果事件的处理持续时间超过, 则可能会在另一个线程上再次引发该事件。If processing of the event lasts longer than , the event might be raised again on another thread. 在这种情况下, 事件处理程序应该是可重入的。In this situation, the event handler should be reentrant. > [!NOTE] > 事件处理方法可能在一个线程上运行, 同时另一个线程调用方法或将属性设置为`false`。The event-handling method might run on one thread at the same time that another thread calls the method or sets the property to `false`. 这可能会导致在计时器停止后引发事件。This might result in the event being raised after the timer is stopped. 方法的代码示例演示了一种避免此争用条件的方法。The example code for the method shows one way to avoid this race condition. 即使不 `false`是, 在调用或方法之后或属性设置为之后, 也可能发生事件, 因为引发`null` 在线程池线程上, 事件始终处于排队等待执行。Even if is not `null`, events can occur after the or method has been called or after the property has been set to `false`, because the signal to raise the event is always queued for execution on a thread pool thread. 解决此争用情况的一种方法是设置一个标志, 该标志通知事件的事件处理程序忽略后续事件。One way to resolve this race condition is to set a flag that tells the event handler for the event to ignore subsequent events. 如果将类用于用户界面元素 (如窗体或控件), 而不将计时器放置在该用户界面元素上, 请将包含的窗体或控件分配给该属性, 以便事件已封送到用户界面线程。If you use the class with a user interface element, such as a form or control, without placing the timer on that user interface element, assign the form or control that contains the to the property, so that the event is marshaled to the user interface thread. 有关实例的默认属性值的列表, 请参见构造函数。For a list of default property values for an instance of , see the constructor. > [!TIP] > 请注意, .net 包含四个名`Timer`为的类, 每个类都提供不同的功能:Be aware that .NET includes four classes named `Timer`, each of which offers different functionality: > > - (本主题): 按固定间隔触发事件。 (this topic): fires an event at regular intervals. 类旨在用作多线程环境中基于服务器的组件或服务组件;它没有用户界面, 在运行时不可见。The class is intended for use as a server-based or service component in a multithreaded environment; it has no user interface and is not visible at runtime. > - : 按固定间隔对线程池线程执行单个回调方法。: executes a single callback method on a thread pool thread at regular intervals. 回调方法是在实例化计时器时定义的, 无法更改。The callback method is defined when the timer is instantiated and cannot be changed. 与类一样, 此类应在多线程环境中用作基于服务器的或服务组件; 它没有用户界面, 在运行时不可见。Like the class, this class is intended for use as a server-based or service component in a multithreaded environment; it has no user interface and is not visible at runtime. > - (仅 .NET Framework): 定期触发事件的 Windows 窗体组件。 (.NET Framework only): a Windows Forms component that fires an event at regular intervals. 该组件没有用户界面，专门用于单线程环境。The component has no user interface and is designed for use in a single-threaded environment. > - (仅 .NET Framework): 按固定间隔执行异步或同步网页回发的 ASP.NET 组件。 (.NET Framework only): an ASP.NET component that performs asynchronous or synchronous web page postbacks at a regular interval. ## Examples 下面的示例实例化`System.Timers.Timer`一个对象, 该对象每隔两秒 (2000 毫秒) 触发其事件, 并为事件设置一个事件处理程序并启动计时器。The following example instantiates a `System.Timers.Timer` object that fires its event every two seconds (2,000 milliseconds), sets up an event handler for the event, and starts the timer. 每次引发属性时, 事件处理程序都将显示该属性的值。The event handler displays the value of the property each time it is raised. [!code-csharp[System.Timers.Timer#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timers.timer/cs/timer2a.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Timers.Timer#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timers.timer/vb/timer2a.vb#2)]

threadsafe.span: 但不保证所有实例成员都是线程安全的。

span.span: Any instance members are not guaranteed to be thread safe.

[!code-csharp[System.Timers.Timer#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timers.timer/cs/AsyncHandlerEx1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Timers.Timer#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timers.timer/vb/AsyncHandlerEx1.vb#3)]

summary.span: 获取或设置一个布尔值，该值指示 是否应只引发一次 事件（() 或重复 ()）。

span.span: Gets or sets a Boolean indicating whether the should raise the event only once () or repeatedly ().

value.span: 如果 应在每次间隔结束时引发 事件，则为 ；如果它仅在间隔第一次结束后引发一次 事件，则为 。

span.span: if the should raise the event each time the interval elapses; if it should raise the event only once, after the first time the interval elapses.
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果在调用方法时已启用, 则重置间隔。 If the is already enabled when the method is called, the interval is reset. 如果为`false` ,则必须调用方法才能重新开始计数。If is `false`, the method must be called in order to start the count again. 重置间隔会影响引发事件的时间。Resetting the interval affects when the event is raised. 例如, 如果将间隔设置为5秒, 然后将属性设置为`true`, 则会在设置时开始计数。For example, if you set the interval to 5 seconds and then set the property to `true`, the count starts at the time is set. 如果在计数为3秒时将间隔重置为10秒, 则该事件将在属性设置为`true`13 秒后首次引发。If you reset the interval to 10 seconds when the count is 3 seconds, the event is raised for the first time 13 seconds after the property was set to `true`. ## Examples 下面的示例创建一个 , 其事件在1.5 秒后激发。The following example creates a whose event fires after 1.5 seconds. 然后, 它的事件处理程序显示 "Hello World!"Its event handler then displays "Hello World!" 在控制台上。on the console. [!code-cpp[Classic Timer.Timer1 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic Timer.Timer1 Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic Timer.Timer1 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic Timer.Timer1 Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic Timer.Timer1 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic Timer.Timer1 Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public Custom Event Elapsed As ElapsedEventHandler

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Timers.TimersDescription("Occurs when the Interval has elapsed.")

span.span: Occurs when the interval elapses.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果属性为 ,`true`并且属性定义的时间间隔 (以毫秒为单位), 则会引发事件。 The event is raised if the property is `true` and the time interval (in milliseconds) defined by the property elapses. 如果属性为`true`, 则该事件将按属性定义的时间间隔重复引发; 否则, 该事件只引发一次, 即值的第一次。 If the property is `true`, the event is raised repeatedly at an interval defined by the property; otherwise, the event is raised only once, the first time the value elapses. 如果是在启动后设置的, 则会重置计数。If is set after the has started, the count is reset. 例如, 如果将间隔设置为5秒, 然后将设置为`true`, 则在设置时 , 将开始计数。For example, if you set the interval to 5 seconds and then set to `true`, the count starts at the time is set. 如果在计数为3秒时将间隔重置为10秒, 则在将设置为`true`第13秒后第一次引发事件。If you reset the interval to 10 seconds when count is 3 seconds, the event is raised for the first time 13 seconds after was set to `true`. 如果属性为`null` ,则在线程上引发事件。 If the property is `null`,the event is raised on a thread. 如果事件的处理持续时间超过, 则可能会在另一个线程上再次引发该事件。If the processing of the event lasts longer than , the event might be raised again on another thread. 在这种情况下, 事件处理程序应该是可重入的。In this situation, the event handler should be reentrant. > [!NOTE] > 事件处理方法可能在一个线程上运行, 同时另一个线程调用方法或将属性设置为`false`。The event-handling method might run on one thread at the same time that another thread calls the method or sets the property to `false`. 这可能会导致在计时器停止后引发事件。This might result in the event being raised after the timer is stopped. 方法的代码示例演示了一种避免此争用条件的方法。The example code for the method shows one way to avoid this race condition. 即使不 `false`是, 在调用或方法之后或属性设置为之后, 也可能发生事件, 因为引发`null` 在线程池线程上, 事件始终处于排队等待执行。Even if is not `null`, events can occur after the or method has been called or after the property has been set to `false`, because the signal to raise the event is always queued for execution on a thread pool thread. 解决此争用情况的一种方法是设置一个标志, 该标志通知事件的事件处理程序忽略后续事件。One way to resolve this race condition is to set a flag that tells the event handler for the event to ignore subsequent events. 组件捕获并取消事件的事件处理程序引发的所有异常。 The component catches and suppresses all exceptions thrown by event handlers for the event. 在未来版本的 .NET Framework 中, 此行为可能会发生更改。This behavior is subject to change in future releases of the .NET Framework. ## Examples 下面的示例实例化一个对象, 该对象每隔两秒 (2000 毫秒) 触发其事件, 并为事件设置一个事件处理程序并启动计时器。The following example instantiates a object that fires its event every two seconds (2000 milliseconds), sets up an event handler for the event, and starts the timer. 每次引发属性时, 事件处理程序都将显示该属性的值。The event handler displays the value of the property each time it is raised. [!code-cpp[System.Timers.Timer#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timers.timer/cpp/timer1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Timers.Timer#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timers.timer/cs/timer1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Timers.Timer#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timers.timer/vb/timer1.vb#1)]

summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，该值指示 是否应引发 事件。

span.span: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the should raise the event.

value.span: 如果 应引发 事件，则为 ；否则，为 。

span.span: if the should raise the event; otherwise, .
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 将设置`true`为与调用相同, 而将设置为`false`与调用相同。Setting to `true` is the same as calling , while setting to `false` is the same as calling . > [!NOTE] > 引发事件的信号总是排队等候在线程上执行。The signal to raise the event is always queued for execution on a thread. 这可能导致在将属性设置为`false`之后引发事件。This might result in the event being raised after the property is set to `false`. 方法的代码示例演示了一种解决此争用条件的方法。The code example for the method shows one way to work around this race condition. 如果将设置为`true`并将设置为`false`, 则在第一次时间间隔结束时, 只引发一次事件。If is set to `true` and is set to `false`, the raises the event only once, the first time the interval elapses. 如果在开始后设置间隔, 则重置计数。If the interval is set after the has started, the count is reset. 例如, 如果将间隔设置为5秒, 然后将属性设置为`true`, 则会在设置时开始计数。For example, if you set the interval to 5 seconds and then set the property to `true`, the count starts at the time is set. 如果在计数为3秒时将间隔重置为10秒, 则在将设置为`true`第13秒后第一次引发事件。If you reset the interval to 10 seconds when count is 3 seconds, the event is raised for the first time 13 seconds after was set to `true`. > [!NOTE] > 某些可视化设计器 (如 Microsoft Visual Studio 中的设计器) 在插入`true`新的时将属性设置为。Some visual designers, such as those in Microsoft Visual Studio, set the property to `true` when inserting a new . ## Examples 下面的示例实例化一个对象, 该对象每隔两秒 (2000 毫秒) 触发其事件, 并为事件设置一个事件处理程序并启动计时器。The following example instantiates a object that fires its event every two seconds (2000 milliseconds), sets up an event handler for the event, and starts the timer. 每次引发属性时, 事件处理程序都将显示该属性的值。The event handler displays the value of the property each time it is raised. [!code-cpp[System.Timers.Timer#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timers.timer/cpp/timer1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Timers.Timer#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timers.timer/cs/timer1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Timers.Timer#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timers.timer/vb/timer1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/includes/vsprvslong-md.md)]设计环境使用此方法来结束在窗体上使用或由另一个组件使用的组件的初始化。The [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/includes/vsprvslong-md.md)] design environment uses this method to end the initialization of a component that is used on a form or by another component. 方法启动初始化。The method starts the initialization. 使用和方法可防止控件在完全初始化之前被使用。Using the and methods prevents the control from being used before it is fully initialized.

The default is 100 milliseconds.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用属性来确定触发事件的频率。You use the property to determine the frequency at which the event is fired. 因为类依赖于系统时钟, 所以它具有与系统时钟相同的分辨率。Because the class depends on the system clock, it has the same resolution as the system clock. 这意味着, 如果属性小于系统时钟的分辨率, 则将以系统时钟解析定义的间隔触发事件。This means that the event will fire at an interval defined by the resolution of the system clock if the property is less than the resolution of the system clock. 下面的示例将属性设置为5毫秒。The following example sets the property to 5 milliseconds. 当在系统时钟[!INCLUDE[win7](~/includes/win7-md.md)]的分辨率约为15毫秒的系统上运行时, 事件大约每15毫秒激发一次, 而不是每5毫秒触发一次。When run on a [!INCLUDE[win7](~/includes/win7-md.md)] system whose system clock has a resolution of approximately 15 milliseconds, the event fires approximately every 15 milliseconds rather than every 5 milliseconds. [!code-csharp[System.Timers.Timer.Interval#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timers.timer.interval/cs/interval2.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Timers.Timer.Interval#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timers.timer.interval/vb/interval2.vb#1)] 你可以使用以下代码来确定当前系统上系统时钟的分辨率:You can use the following code to determine the resolution of the system clock on the current system: [!code-csharp[System.Timers.Timer.Interval#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timers.timer.interval/cs/resolution1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Timers.Timer.Interval#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timers.timer.interval/vb/resolution1.vb#2)] 如果你的应用程序所需的分辨率比类或系统时钟提供的分辨率大, 请使用高分辨率多媒体计时器, 请参阅[如何:使用高分辨率计时器](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa964692.aspx)。If your app requires greater resolution than that offered by the class or the system clock, use the high-resolution multimedia timers; see [How to: Use the High-Resolution Timer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa964692.aspx). 如果在开始后设置间隔, 则重置计数。If the interval is set after the has started, the count is reset. 例如, 如果将间隔设置为5秒, 然后将属性设置为`true`, 则会在设置时开始计数。For example, if you set the interval to 5 seconds and then set the property to `true`, the count starts at the time is set. 如果在计数为3秒时将间隔重置为10秒, 则在将设置为`true`第13秒后第一次引发事件。If you reset the interval to 10 seconds when count is 3 seconds, the event is raised for the first time 13 seconds after was set to `true`. 如果将设置为`true`并将设置为`false`, 则在第一次时间间隔结束时, 只引发一次事件。If is set to `true` and is set to `false`, the raises the event only once, the first time the interval elapses. 然后, 将设置`false`为。 is then set to `false`. > [!NOTE] > 如果 `false`和 均设置为, 并且之前已启用计时器, 则设置属性将导致事件引发一次, 就好像属性已设置为 `true`.If and are both set to `false`, and the timer has previously been enabled, setting the property causes the event to be raised once, as if the property had been set to `true`. 若要设置间隔而不引发事件, 可以暂时将属性设置为`true`, 将属性设置为所需的时间间隔, 然后立即将属性重新设置为`false`。To set the interval without raising the event, you can temporarily set the property to `true`, set the property to the desired time interval, and then immediately set the property back to `false`. ## Examples 下面的示例实例化一个对象, 该对象每隔两秒 (2000 毫秒) 触发其事件, 并为事件设置一个事件处理程序并启动计时器。The following example instantiates a object that fires its event every two seconds (2000 milliseconds), sets up an event handler for the event, and starts the timer. 每次引发属性时, 事件处理程序都将显示该属性的值。The event handler displays the value of the property each time it is raised. [!code-cpp[System.Timers.Timer#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timers.timer/cpp/timer1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Timers.Timer#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timers.timer/cs/timer1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Timers.Timer#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timers.timer/vb/timer1.vb#1)]

summary.span: 通过将 设置为 开始引发 事件。

span.span: Starts raising the event by setting to .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果调用了并且将设置`false`为,则在第一次时间间隔结束时, 仅引发一次事件。If is called and is set to `false`, the raises the event only once, the first time the interval elapses. 如果 `true`调用并为,则会在每次间隔结束时引发事件,并继续在指定间隔内引发事件。If is called and is `true`, the raises the event the first time the interval elapses and continues to raise the event on the specified interval. 还可以通过将设置为来`true`开始计时。You can also start timing by setting to `true`. > [!NOTE] > 如果为`false` ,则必须调用方法才能重新开始计数。If is `false`, the method must be called in order to start the count again. 当启用计时器时 , 对方法的调用不起作用。A call to the method when the timer is enabled has no effect.

exception.span: 创建 ，使其时间间隔等于或大于 + 1，或将其时间间隔设置为小于零。

span.span: The is created with an interval equal to or greater than + 1, or set to an interval less than zero.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Stop() cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

summary.span: 通过将 设置为 停止引发 事件。

span.span: Stops raising the event by setting to .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 还可以通过将设置为来`false`停止计时。You can also stop timing by setting to `false`. > [!NOTE] > 引发事件的信号始终排入队列以便在线程上执行, 因此, 事件处理方法可能会在一个线程上运行, 同时在另一个线程上运行对该方法的调用。The signal to raise the event is always queued for execution on a thread, so the event-handling method might run on one thread at the same time that a call to the method runs on another thread. 这可能会导致在调用方法后引发事件。This might result in the event being raised after the method is called. "[示例](#examples)" 部分中的第二个代码示例演示了解决此争用情况的一种方法。The second code example in the [Examples](#examples) section shows one way to work around this race condition. ## Examples 下面的示例实例化`System.Timers.Timer`一个对象, 该对象每隔两秒 (2000 毫秒) 触发其事件, 并为事件设置一个事件处理程序并启动计时器。The following example instantiates a `System.Timers.Timer` object that fires its event every two seconds (2,000 milliseconds), sets up an event handler for the event, and starts the timer. 每次引发属性时, 事件处理程序都将显示该属性的值。The event handler displays the value of the property each time it is raised. 当用户按 Enter 键时, 应用程序将在终止应用程序之前调用方法。When the user presses the Enter key, the application calls the method before terminating the application. [!code-csharp[System.Timers.Timer#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timers.timer/cs/timer2a.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Timers.Timer#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timers.timer/vb/timer2a.vb#2)] 下面的代码示例演示了一种方法, 用于阻止调用方法的线程继续运行, 直到当前正在执行的事件结束, 同时防止两个事件以相同的方式执行事件处理程序。时间 (通常称为重入)。The following code example shows one way to prevent the thread that calls the method from continuing until a currently executing event ends, and also to prevent two events from executing the event handler at the same time (often referred to as reentrancy). 该示例执行100个测试运行。The example executes 100 test runs. 每次运行测试时, 将以150毫秒为间隔启动计时器。Each time the test is run, the timer is started with an interval of 150 milliseconds. 事件处理程序使用方法来模拟随机变化的任务, 长度从50到200毫秒。The event handler uses the method to simulate a task that randomly varies in length from 50 to 200 milliseconds. 测试方法还启动一个控制线程, 该线程等待另一个线程, 然后停止计时器。The test method also starts a control thread that waits for a second and then stops the timer. 如果在控制线程停止计时器时处理某个事件, 则控制线程必须等待事件完成, 然后再继续。If an event is being handled when the control thread stops the timer, the control thread must wait until the event is finished before proceeding. 方法重载用于避免重新进入, 并防止控制线程继续运行, 直到执行事件结束。The method overload is used to avoid reentrancy and to prevent the control thread from continuing until an executing event ends. 事件处理程序使用方法将控制变量设置为 1, 但仅当该值当前为零时。The event handler uses the method to set a control variable to 1, but only if the value is currently zero. 这是一个原子操作。This is an atomic operation. 如果返回值为零, 则控制变量已设置为 1, 事件处理程序将继续。If the return value is zero, the control variable has been set to 1 and the event handler proceeds. 如果返回值不为零, 则只会丢弃事件以避免重新进入。If the return value is non-zero, the event is simply discarded to avoid reentrancy. (如果有必要执行每个事件, 则类将是同步事件的更好方法。)当事件处理程序结束时, 它会将控制变量设置回零。(If it were necessary to execute every event, the class would be a better way to synchronize the events.) When the event handler ends, it sets the control variable back to zero. 该示例记录由于重新进入而放弃并在调用方法后发生的事件的总数。The example records the total number of events that executed, that were discarded because of reentrancy, and that occurred after the method was called. 控制线程使用方法将控制变量设置为-1 (减一), 但仅当该值当前为零时。The control thread uses the method to set the control variable to -1 (minus one), but only if the value is currently zero. 如果原子操作返回非零值, 则当前正在执行事件。If the atomic operation returns non-zero, an event is currently executing. 控制线程将等待并再次尝试。The control thread waits and tries again. 该示例记录控制线程等待事件完成的次数。The example records the number of times the control thread had to wait for an event to finish. [!code-csharp[Timer.Stop#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Timer.Stop/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Timer.Stop#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Timer.Stop/VB/source.vb#1)]

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Timers.TimersDescription("The object used to marshal the event handler calls issued when an interval has elapsed.")
set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

summary.span: 获取或设置对象，该对象用于在间隔过后封送发出的事件处理程序调用。

span.span: Gets or sets the object used to marshal event-handler calls that are issued when an interval has elapsed.

value.span: ，它表示对象，该对象用于在间隔过后封送发出的事件处理程序调用。

span.span: The representing the object used to marshal the event-handler calls that are issued when an interval has elapsed.
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当为`null`时, 处理事件的方法将在系统线程池中的线程上调用。When is `null`, the method that handles the event is called on a thread from the system-thread pool. 有关系统线程池的详细信息, 请参阅。For more information on system-thread pools, see . 当事件由视觉对象 Windows 窗体组件 (如按钮) 处理时, 通过系统线程池访问该组件可能会导致异常或可能不起作用。When the event is handled by a visual Windows Forms component, such as a button, accessing the component through the system-thread pool might result in an exception or just might not work. 通过将设置为 Windows 窗体组件来避免这种影响, 这会使处理事件的方法在创建该组件的同一线程上进行调用。Avoid this effect by setting to a Windows Forms component, which causes the method that handles the event to be called on the same thread that the component was created on. > [!NOTE] > `null` `false`即使属性不为, 在调用或方法之后或在属性设置为之后, 也可能发生事件, 因为引发的信号此事件始终在线程池线程上排队等待执行。Even if the property is not `null`, events can occur after the or method has been called or after the property has been set to `false`, because the signal to raise the event is always queued for execution on a thread pool thread. 解决此争用情况的一种方法是设置一个标志, 该标志通知事件的事件处理程序忽略后续事件。One way to resolve this race condition is to set a flag that tells the event handler for the event to ignore subsequent events. 如果在 Windows 窗体设计器中的 Visual Studio 内使用, 则将自动设置为包含的控件。If the is used inside Visual Studio in a Windows Forms designer, is automatically set to the control that contains the . 例如 , 如果在的`Form1`设计器上放置 ( 继承自), 则的属性将设置为的实例`Form1`。For example, if you place a on a designer for `Form1` (which inherits from ), the property of is set to the instance of `Form1`. ## Examples 下面的示例是一个充当非常简单的文本文件编辑器的 Windows 窗体应用程序。The following example is a Windows Forms app that serves as a very simple text file editor. 如果尚未保存文本框中的文本, 应用程序会在一分钟的时间间隔内询问用户是否要保存文本框的内容。When the text in the text box has not been saved, the app asks the user at one-minute intervals whether he or she wants to save the contents of the text box. 为此, 将属性设置为一分钟 (60000 毫秒), 并将属性设置为对象。To do this, the property is set to one minute (60,000 milliseconds), and the property is set to the object. [!code-csharp[System.Timers.Timer.SynchronizingObject#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Timers.Timer.SynchronizingObject/cs/Form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Timers.Timer.SynchronizingObject#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Timers.Timer.SynchronizingObject/vb/Form1.vb#1)] 该示例要求你将以下控件添加到窗体中:The example requires that you add the following controls to the form: - 名 为`TextBox1`的控件 (默认名称)。A control named `TextBox1` (its default name). - 名 为`Button1`的控件 (默认名称)。A control named `Button1` (its default name). - 名 为`SaveSaveFileDialog1`的控件 (默认名称)。A control named `SaveSaveFileDialog1` (its default name) .
